description: Group oral presentation (10 minutes) on an RNA sequencing dataset, explaining its importance and genome-wide approaches. Includes peer scoring and staff assessment.
45-minute mid-term quiz with 30 multiple-choice questions covering genome structure, variation, and evolutionary concepts from Weeks 1-5 material.
Individual term-long project analyzing RNA-seq data with a report (2000 words max). Part A covers methods/results (30%), Part B discusses future directions (10%). Involves commandline/GUI tools.
2-hour online exam with three essay questions (one from each section: Genes/Genomics, Molecular Evolution, Applications). Tests Weeks 1-10 lecture content.
